pr_title: [HUDI-1357] Added a check to ensure no records are lost during updates.

timeline.bodyText: as far as I can tell, we only use this within HoodieMergeHandle.  Can we avoid adding the extra member here and simply use a local variable? I am trying to understand the use-case for logging this in stat.
timeline.author: vinothchandar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -49,6 +49,12 @@
    */
   private String prevCommit;
 
+  /**
+   * Total number of records written to the previous version of the file slice.
+   * If inflight commit is c2, then number of records present in f1_w1_c1.parquet.
+   */
+  private long oldNumWrites;

replies.bodyText: @nbalajee Do you have a reason for this requirement? Seems ok to remove saving it.
replies.author: prashantwason
nbalajee

replies.bodyText: @nbalajee If we move this outside of  isDatalossCheckEnabled() condition, then wont it always read the older parquet files each time before commit? If so, there is not much to the setting anyways because the overhead of this feature is reading the older parquet each time before merge.
replies.author: prashantwason

replies.bodyText:
@nbalajee I totally understand. but we could log this out and use elastic search or some other infrastructure to debug right. I would really love to not mix debug information with something as critical as commit metadata.
This sets a precedent that we cannot follow going forward :)
replies.author: vinothchandar

timeline.bodyText: sweet. I was going to suggest this. you are ahead!
timeline.author: vinothchandar

timeline.bodyText: let's name this specific to real purpose like. hoodie.merge.data.validation.enabled , avoiding the calling this loss checking etc, which can be rather disconcerting to users, when they read this.
timeline.author: vinothchandar
